channel.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
channel.description:
I made this, i found better render settings to make it look alot better, but i still feel as if somethings screwed up.
[img]http://img176.imageshack.us/img176/1346/sunlightya2.png[/img]
It looked decent to me, then i looked at it over and over and i felt like it was starting to suck, but that might of been because i was getting sick of looking at it...

item.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
item.dc:creator: @OmidSan OmidSan
item.description:
@OmidSan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:16, topic:189791”][quote author=OmidSan link=topic=252740.msg2119556#msg2119556 date=1205907047]
Lmfao, the house is on the lake. It’s floating. xDD
[/quote]
Im going to use this same concept to recreate a hotel i stayed in, but this ‘school’ thing is fucking annoying.[/quote]
Haha ok. O.

step one:

I want to start working with graphics, someone want to hook me up with some programs? like the names or w/e. Oh btw in my eyes its an awesome picture. ;D

a starting program for u–GIMP
If you want to spend money—Photoshop.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Fix the flaws =D

Yeah, backgrounds are hard.

Negative on the spotlight.

You can either use infinite, or the actual sun object. both are the same, the sun just has real life settings, but can take some getting used to.

I usually use an infinite, and place it outside the house, and aim the blue axis where I want the sunlight to point. then area shadows.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:12, topic:189791”]Change the background. And it doesn’t fit your lighting.

You’re not really going to get that soft of shadows with a sun.

And the chairs don’t fit at all, neither does anything else scalewise.

Windows need to be not as tall and be higher up from the floor.

Chairs are pretty tall and fat compared to the walls. Also, the walls give a feeling of closemindedness.

Other than that, I think it’s alright. But the lighting is odd. Need a brighter intensity of the direct sunlight and overall brighter image.[/quote]
Cant find a better background =\ If i google for images i only find ‘wildlife’ type stuff. Nothing rural.
The room does feel it needs to be wider and more spacier.
Im going to give up on wood floors, lol there making me sick.
I wasnt to sure on how bright the scene needed to be, because when its to bright it reveals flaws and other things.

Also, im using a spotlight for sun, i tried infinite, that worked alright, but what one is better?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Change the background. And it doesn’t fit your lighting.

You’re not really going to get that soft of shadows with a sun.

And the chairs don’t fit at all, neither does anything else scalewise.

Windows need to be not as tall and be higher up from the floor.

Chairs are pretty tall and fat compared to the walls. Also, the walls give a feeling of closemindedness.

Other than that, I think it’s alright. But the lighting is odd. Need a brighter intensity of the direct sunlight and overall brighter image.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Yea i noursain’. I might go for a more ‘futuristic abstract’ type look.

Read full topic

item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Tile can be in every room of the house if you want a more modern look. Carpet is just the default thing, yano?

item.title: [C4D] Sunlight help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

exe626:

If you really want a shiny floor, you should go with tile or something to to that effect. Wood just really isn’t that shiny.

Tile isnt in living rooms… is it?

Read full topic
